alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 8:38PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, for the Chilkat River and Porcupine Creek in the Northern Inner Channels. * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 835 PM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Chilkat and Klehini Rivers along with Porcupine Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible. - Areas around mile post 14 and 24 of the Haines Highway and around Porcupine Creek is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - For Chilkat River at Klukwan: At 8:00pm the stage was 125.0 feet. Flood Stage is 128.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 128.5 feet is expected around 10:00pm Saturday. Impacts: At 127.0 feet: This is bankfull stage, but water can encroach the Haines Highway, south of Klukwan. Note that the Chilkat River is highly braided, if and when it shifts channels, our present bankfull and flood stages will be outdated. At 128.5 feet: Water will flood the property of Chilkat River Adventures just upstream of the Chilkat River bridge with some other minor flooding near 14 mile and 25 mile boat launches and along Porcupine Road. - If you live or recreate along Chilkat River or Porcupine Creek stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
